basics.name: Sergio Acosta Quintana
basics.label: Backend Software Engineer | Java & Distributed Systems
basics.summary: Backend Engineer specializing in high-availability Java microservices and event-driven architectures. Modernized enterprise systems at IKEA, improving latency, reliability, and operational efficiency. Focused on distributed systems, cloud infrastructure (AWS), and production automation. Experienced in Clean Architecture, observability (Prometheus/Grafana), and GitHub Actions CI/CD.

work.name: IKEA / BITBOX S.L.
highlights: Architected high-throughput Spring Boot microservices for IKEA's loyalty platform processing 2M+ monthly transactions for 400k+ users with 99.9% uptime.
Led migration from PL/SQL monoliths to Event-Driven Architecture with Apache Kafka (15+ topics, 50k+ daily events), implementing circuit breakers and retry strategies.
Automated data pipelines via GitHub Actions, replacing 7 manual batch jobs, reducing processing time 55% and enabling blue-green deployments.
Designed multi-provider insurance aggregation using async microservices with JWT auth, RBAC, and Prometheus/Grafana monitoring dashboards.

projects.name: NEXO CLOUD (SaaS)
highlights: Designed S3 + RDS + Redis architecture for async document ingestion workflows. Processes 30k+ docs monthly across multi-tenant production environments.
Implemented end-to-end event-driven pipeline (1k+ docs/hour, p99 <200ms) with dead letter queues, idempotent consumers, and automated PostgreSQL backups.
Integrated OpenAI API with query optimization, index tuning, and batch processing, cutting costs 30%. Built React monitoring dashboard with Tailwind.
